column4: to be fair, much of the effort behind mono is lower-level, or web-based (aspx), so that's only at the desktop app level.
the person who worked on wxNET was one of the trolls
I don't think that was the exact area of focus for mono. Application support is a must.

well, there are multiple areas of focus.  For desktop apps, they have punted to GTK/Gnome, granted.  And I don't blame them, really.  But there are many other uses.  My complaint is lack of full/decent support for databases like oracle, etc..
